Articles.Content:
Wait... He moved. That sneaky $*#@%&! He decided to 'commandeer' the latest aircraft from the SPH. The result?

This.

Followed by this.

You must admit... he looks concerned in that last one.

He is now is a SEALED container, surrounded by 20m high walls.

Poor Jeb first ended up on a weird orbit around the Mun on a sparse tech tree, and after managing to do a rescue mission with low margin of error, he got sent to the north pole and has been stuck there since then.
New career using TAC life support... Did a nice little minmus science trip but had inadequate solar panels and batteries.... So yeah, Jeb's dead, baby...

Dead.

killed in a crash landing from a too steep interplanetary return that tore all the parachutes off the craft.

Should he be found again he's off to Eve.
Stranded with Bill and Bob in orbit around Dres. They have quite a bit of delta-V, but not enough. A rescue mission is planned, but it's going to be a while.
Currently stranded on Laythe in a plane missing 2/3 engines
Stuck in a crater on the Mun in a broken rover. It's a loooong walk to the base, so maybe a rescue mission is in order...
Piloting shuttles to Highlab, (Skylab). Later he will go to the KSS for a short stay as one of the first crew members.
Stranded in a botched landing attempt on the Mun with Bill and Bob. The cockpit was the only thing to survive the plunge down the side of the crater.
On its way to Eeloo for my first manned landing attempt. He is joined by Bill.
To hell and back. But didn't make it COMPLETELY back... GAME OVER YEAAAAAAAAAAH!!!!!
Testing my BlackStar hypersonic jet at about 2,320 m/s at 41,000m

Testing my BlackStar hypersonic jet at about 2,320 m/s at 41,000m

Goodness, that's quite a jet. Probably almost orbital at that point.

My latest incarnation of Jeb is taking a vacation at my boring LKO refueling station.

Currently stranded on Laythe in a plane missing 2/3 engines

Snap, my Jeb is stranded on Laythe too. Though his craft is perfectly fine, it has about enough fuel to get about 20 meters of the ground and then crash.

Just launched my rescue craft this morning....I'm highly confident about it landing on Laythe, but highly suspicious about it's ability to make orbit or for it's orbital long range tank to have enough juice to get everyone back to Kerbin. Joolian gravity is an unforgiving mistress.

At KSC waiting for the next trip to the Mun, because the two way trip to Duna is still under testing. And my lifter for the interplanetary engine can't get off the ground... Maybe I really do need more struts?..
I just rescued him from the mun. I sent him there on my second flight in the latest career mode in a reaction wheel powered landing gear rover, and only now got around to bringing him home.

Ok, update.

He got promoted to Deputy Director, and he's nolonger a astronaut. Soon after, there was only 6% as much explosions as before.

I'm happy to report that my Jeb is finally home after being stranded in inter-planetary space for quite a while. It just took me a fair bit of time to gather the Science! needed to be able to reliably get him. Check out my you-tube channel for the let's plays, he gets stranded in episode 6 or 7. I just filmed his rescue last night, although that Let's Play may not be posted until next week.
Only the best missions for the best kerbals! He is currently on Laythe with a 10 kerbal, solar powered colony.
Currently orbiting Kerbin on a failed EVA. Have yet to try to rescue him.
On a rover on the Old abandoned airport on the island. He's doing science, (aka stopping him from boarding all the rockets).
On my first "landing" on Duna. The Magic Boulder smashed the lander. Vanguard Industries EVA parachutes saved his life.
He recently was rescued from Minmus after failing to rescue Doodbert Kerman. This is after he reincarnated after the very first flight in my career mode save. Remember kids, No EVA-ing in Atmosphere.

On Eve

All in all, he's never coming back, unless the kraken somehow hurls him from Eve at Kerbin...
I've banished him to the skybox.
